author: Boudewijn Rempt
message: I usually use Gwenview to give presentations these days :-). I have a slideshow of nice images done in Krita, and then talk about Krita for twenty minutes.

replies.author: Aurélien Gâteau
replies.message:
They don't make much sense on their own: I try not to write too much on slides to avoid reading them, so they act as a support for the presentation. The slides often introduce what I am going to demonstrate next: in this presentation I switched a lot between an actual Kdenlive window and the slides.

The presentation has been video-recorded though: when the video is online I'll link to it and publish the slides as well.

replies.author: Aurélien Gâteau
replies.message: The slides and video recording of the presentation are now available from http://agateau.com/talks/

author: mbonnin
message: I had the exact same problem recently. I wanted markdown support and something simple to use with a clean look. In the end I ended up customizing the google io 2012 templates (https://code.google.com/p/i.... It has a python scripts that generates html+js from markdown + a jinja template. Or you can edit the html directly. The real pain in the neck is inserting images though....

author: Casper Clemence
message:
I found about 15 or 20 tools which do something like this, which I have filtered down to the following:

HTML + markdown

markdown to impress.js

markdown to deck.js

markdown to simple bold slides

RMarkdown based

Markdown to impress.js

restructuredtext to impress.js
